image.altText: A beautifully refurbished church which is now a school's performing arts centre

props.synopsis: St Michael's Grammar School in St Kilda says the staff member responsible for an annotated cast list for the Year 6 musical has resigned from their position.

title.children: Staffer resigns over inappropriate descriptions of students

image.altText: Police cars block off part of Bell Street after a fatality involving a truck

props.synopsis: Emergency crews treated the woman at the scene, but she could not be revived.

title.children: Female pedestrian dies after being hit by truck in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A woman in a black long sleeved shirt with her arms crossed.

props.synopsis: A regional football league is demanding an explanation from one of its clubs over repeated comments about a journalist online.

title.children: League demands explanation after football journalist feels bullied by players

image.altText: A sign reminding bus passengers to pay their bus fare

props.synopsis: Documents say less than a third of Melbourne bus commuters are touching on their Myki card to pay the fare, with the revenue loss potentially climbing into the millions.

title.children: 'Like I run a free service': touch-on rates declining on Melbourne buses

image.altText: A man with short black hair and an earring in his left ear stares at the camera with a blue studio backdrop.

props.synopsis: The charges follow the death of a 26-year-old Seabrook man, Kwar Ater, on Elizabeth Street earlier this month.

title.children: Two men charged with murder after Melbourne CBD drive-by shooting

image.altText: Bobby Hill touches his face with his left hand at a Magpies' AFL training session.

props.synopsis: Coach Craig McRae reveals he has spoken with Bobby Hill about his chances of playing in the AFL finals, as the Magpies ramp up preparations for Saturday's preliminary final against Lions.

title.children: Magpies make 'really difficult' call on star forward for preliminary final

image.altText: A tail of a Qantas plane is seen on the runway at Sydney Airport, Sydney,

props.synopsis: There are concerns the decision could impact regional flights, as staff would have to travel from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane to get to work.

title.children: Qantas may close staff bases in Mildura, Canberra and Hobart

image.altText: A group of black cows gathered around fresh hay in a dry field.

props.synopsis: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

title.children: Record Aussie cow price as US demand hits 'scary times'

image.altText: A woman standing with arms on a fence.

props.synopsis: Farmers in southern New South Wales are protecting parts of their land in perpetuity, fencing off tens of hectares for conservation.

title.children: Farmers paid to fence off land forever for conservation

image.altText: Animated characters in a small town, a female character with large horns sits in a red dress on a bench.

props.synopsis: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

title.children: This Aussie game broke the internet. A new exhibit reveals how it was made

image.altText: A woman dressed as a Christmas elf holding a small dog.

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has finally announced the start date of a trial of pets on flights, beginning next month between Melbourne and the Gold and Sunshine coasts.

title.children: Airline receives mixed reactions to pet passenger trial

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: About 400 educators were issued prohibition orders banning them from early education or care in the past five years, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Parents kept in the dark over hundreds of blacklisted childcare workers

image.altText: A young double bassist performs with other kids outdoors. They're grinning and wearing orange. People watch in the background.

props.synopsis: With youth orchestras set to busk on the streets of Sydney and Melbourne this weekend, Australian musicians share how those orchestras helped shape their careers.

title.children: Musicians share how youth orchestras kick-started their careers

image.altText: A group of wind turbines are silhouetted against the sky at sunset, land is dark, but the sky is well lit.

props.synopsis: The Australian Conservation Foundation says it has mapped the east coast of Australia to identify sites suitable for renewable projects that do not impact on biodiversity, helping Australia reach net zero by 2050 with limited damage to nature.

title.children: Quicker, less destructive renewables rollout possible, report finds

image.altText: A man in a Fire Forest Management Victoria jacket standing in front of trees.

props.synopsis: Firefighters say they learnt a lot from the Black Summer bushfires, but fear Victorians have become complacent in preparations ahead of this fire season.

title.children: Black Summer efforts honoured as CFA warns against complacency

image.altText: A wallaby

props.synopsis: A council on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula has voted to relocate starving wallabies from The Briars wildlife sanctuary, rather than destroy them.

title.children: Council to relocate starving wallabies from Victorian sanctuary

image.altText: Two police officers escorting a man.

props.synopsis: Two men have faced court after police found $14 million worth of cocaine in a vehicle in Melbourne's north. It's alleged the men were transporting the cocaine for an illegal drug syndicate.

title.children: Police seize 40kg of cocaine in Melbourne bust

image.altText: Two paramedics wheel stretcher beds to an ambulance on a dark street.

props.synopsis: Shania Lee, 26,  was arrested and charged with negligent manslaughter on Tuesday, more than a year after the deadly blaze.

title.children: Mother granted bail after being charged over fatal Melbourne house fire

image.altText: A smiling young woman in a small plane. Through the window a canola crop that spells "will you marry me" can be seen.

props.synopsis: Primary school teacher Steph Carter, 24, is the envy of the Blighty district near the Victoria-NSW border after an elaborate proposal organised by farmer Will Henderson.

title.children: Farmer goes above and beyond for sky-high wedding proposal

image.altText: Composite of Sam Mitchell and Zach Merrett.

props.synopsis: As his young Hawks squad prepare for their preliminary final against the Cats, Sam Mitchell opens up about the club's pursuit of Bombers captain Zach Merrett.

title.children: Hawks coach Mitchell reacts to speculation over Merrett meeting

image.altText: A black and white photograph of a group of smiling young women in the mid-20th century, a ship's rigging in the background

props.synopsis: Signorinella: Little Miss, the new documentary from the filmmakers behind Lygon St — Si Parla Italiano, celebrates the tenacity of Italian Australian women in business and beyond.

title.children: Meet the Italian women who helped build modern Australia

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: The state's police minister vows to urge other states and territories to ban the weapons after more than 1,300 machetes and dangerous knives were surrendered at disposal bins during the first two weeks of his government's machete amnesty.

title.children: Victorian government to push for national machete ban

image.altText: An empty Victorian building train station, cream and red, in the country, trees, and blue skies and no building in site.

props.synopsis: Daniel Kelly broke his leg after he stepped off a V/Line train only to discover the carriage had outrun the platform at his local station.

title.children: V/Line passenger falls from train and breaks leg due to short platform

image.altText: Jacinta Allan gets a selfie with delegation in China

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan's one week trip to the Middle Kingdom is a show with two audiences, as she eyes Chinese investment and hopes to solidify her party's relationship with Chinese Victorians.

title.children: The Victorian premier's trip to China hopes to generate selfies and trade

image.altText: A car drives past a protest banner.

props.synopsis: The state government approves the development of a $453 million energy storage system by a Chinese company in the state's north-east, angering nearby residents who say their concerns have been ignored.

title.children: Regional battery project green-lit by Vic premier during trip to China

image.altText: a man with dark features and a beard smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A councillor is demanding answers from his own executive over the botched Bendigo Writers Festival, asking colleagues whether they want to be remembered as the council that "killed" it.

title.children: Bendigo residents asking 'what the hell happened to the writers festival?'

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: Mother-of-two Elise Turner says she was asked to leave the Virgin Australia business lounge after refusing to go to a bathroom to pump breast milk.

title.children: Virgin Australia apologises after breastfeeding mum ejected from lounge

image.altText: Dead mosquitoes under a microscope at the project lab

props.synopsis: They are the deadliest animals in the world, and millions of them are being sent from Australia to the Laos capital Vientiane in a bid to save lives.

title.children: How Melbourne mosquitoes are being used to fight dengue fever in Laos

image.altText: A woman faces a man in a room. Both are in silouhette.

props.synopsis: A Goodstart worker who allegedly abused toddlers at a Ballarat centre speaks out for the first time and says he is appealing after being banned from working with children.

title.children: Childcare worker accused of abuse says his behaviour was 'misinterpreted'

image.altText: An impression of large white wind turbines in the ocean

props.synopsis: The Victorian government pushes back its timeline for new offshore wind farms in the state's east in a blow to developers looking to move their projects to the next stage.

title.children: Victorian offshore wind auction delay stalls renewable industry's plans

image.altText: High security fence with tree in foreground

props.synopsis: A former youth detainee is jailed over a violent assault that took place when a group of inmates stole a set of keys and sent the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre into lockdown in October 2023.

title.children: Man sentenced over 'truly shocking' youth detention centre assault

image.altText: The foot of Nick Hind of the Bombers is attended to by a physio.

props.synopsis: New research highlights the financial impact of injuries in the AFL, with one club losing $13 millions over six seasons, nearly 17 per cent of its total player salaries.

title.children: The hidden impact of injuries costing AFL clubs millions

image.altText: A photo of a rectangular building wiith red bricks and many broken windows, on a grass surface with nearby bushes

props.synopsis: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

title.children: Trashed former hospital site hits market after years of decay

image.altText: Various items in a state of disarray

props.synopsis: Photos have revealed a chaotic scene inside the Porepunkah property where Dezi Freeman is alleged to have shot and killed two police officers.

title.children: Inside the property where two Victoria Police officers were killed

image.altText: A man looks ahead with a serious expression. Behind him is a wall of a brick house.

props.synopsis: The controversial church offered to settle with Mick Dover over his allegations of abuse, but only if he signed a non-disclosure agreement and agreed not to disparage them in any way.

title.children: 'Not worth it. I'd rather tell you': Mick Dover turned down $1m to do this interview
